stretches.name: Standing Hamstring Stretch
stretches.description: Stand and bend forward at the hips, reaching toward your toes. Keep legs straight and hold for 20-30 seconds.

stretches.name: Quadriceps Standing Stretch
stretches.description: Stand on one leg, pull the other foot toward your glutes. Hold for 20-30 seconds per leg.

stretches.name: Calf Stretch
stretches.description: Place one foot back, keeping heel on ground. Lean forward into the wall. Hold for 20-30 seconds.

stretches.name: Hip Flexor Stretch
stretches.description: Kneel on one knee, other foot forward. Push hips forward gently. Great for people who sit a lot.

stretches.name: Seated Spinal Twist
stretches.description: Sit with legs extended, cross one leg over, twist torso toward bent knee. Excellent for spinal mobility.

stretches.name: Child's Pose
stretches.description: Kneel and sit back on heels, extend arms forward on the ground. Relaxing full-body stretch.

stretches.name: Cat-Cow Stretch
stretches.description: On hands and knees, alternate between arching back up (cat) and down (cow). Great for spine mobility.

stretches.name: Chest Doorway Stretch
stretches.description: Place forearm on doorframe, step forward until you feel stretch in chest. Perfect after bench press.

stretches.name: Shoulder Cross-Body Stretch
stretches.description: Pull one arm across your chest with the other arm. Hold for 20-30 seconds.

stretches.name: Triceps Overhead Stretch
stretches.description: Reach one arm overhead, bend elbow, use other hand to gently pull elbow. Hold for 20-30 seconds.

stretches.name: Standing Side Bend
stretches.description: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, reach one arm overhead and bend to the side. Great for lateral flexibility.

stretches.name: Butterfly Stretch
stretches.description: Sit with soles of feet together, gently press knees toward ground. Excellent for hip mobility.

stretches.name: Pigeon Pose
stretches.description: From plank, bring one knee forward toward same-side wrist. Deep hip opener, great after leg day.

stretches.name: Lying Figure-4 Stretch
stretches.description: Lie on back, cross one ankle over opposite knee, pull thigh toward chest. Perfect for tight glutes.

stretches.name: Cobra Stretch
stretches.description: Lie face down, push upper body up with arms, arch back. Great counter-stretch to sitting.

stretches.name: Downward Dog
stretches.description: Form inverted V-shape with body. Comprehensive full-body stretch from yoga.

stretches.name: Neck Rolls
stretches.description: Slowly roll head in circles, both directions. Relieves tension from desk work.

stretches.name: Wrist Flexor Stretch
stretches.description: Extend arm, pull fingers back with other hand. Essential for people who type or grip weights.

stretches.name: Thread the Needle
stretches.description: From hands and knees, thread one arm under the other, rotating spine. Great for upper back tension.

stretches.name: Standing Quad Stretch with Support
stretches.description: Hold onto wall or chair for balance, pull foot to glutes. Safer variation for beginners.

stretches.name: Leg Swings - Front to Back
stretches.description: Hold support, swing one leg forward and back. Great dynamic warm-up before lower body workout.

stretches.name: Leg Swings - Side to Side
stretches.description: Hold support, swing leg side to side across body. Excellent hip mobility drill.

stretches.name: Arm Circles
stretches.description: Extend arms to sides, make small to large circles. Perfect warm-up before upper body training.

stretches.name: World's Greatest Stretch
stretches.description: Lunge position with rotation and reach. Comprehensive multi-joint mobility exercise.

stretches.name: Lat Stretch on Floor
stretches.description: Kneel and reach arms forward on ground, sit hips back. Targets the latissimus dorsi muscles.

stretches.name: Frog Stretch
stretches.description: On hands and knees, spread knees wide, sit hips back. Deep inner thigh and groin stretch.

stretches.name: Seal Pose
stretches.description: Deeper version of cobra with arms fully extended. Intense abdominal and hip flexor stretch.

stretches.name: 90/90 Hip Stretch
stretches.description: Sit with both legs at 90-degree angles. Excellent for hip internal and external rotation.

stretches.name: Shoulder Dislocations
stretches.description: Hold band with wide grip, rotate arms overhead and behind back. Great shoulder mobility drill.

stretches.name: Deep Squat Hold
stretches.description: Squat all the way down, keep heels on ground, hold position. Comprehensive lower body mobility.

stretches.name: Wrist Extensor Stretch
stretches.description: Extend arm forward with palm down, use other hand to gently pull fingers down. Essential for keyboard users and carpal tunnel prevention.

stretches.name: Prayer Stretch (Wrists)
stretches.description: Press palms together in front of chest, lower hands toward waist while keeping palms pressed. Excellent for wrist flexibility and carpal tunnel relief.

stretches.name: Reverse Prayer Stretch
stretches.description: Place backs of hands together behind your back, palms facing out. Advanced wrist mobility stretch for desk workers.

stretches.name: Wrist Rotations
stretches.description: Rotate wrists in circular motion, both clockwise and counterclockwise. Perfect quick break for typists.

stretches.name: Finger Extensions
stretches.description: Spread fingers wide apart, hold for 5 seconds, then make a fist. Repeat. Reduces tension from typing and gripping.

stretches.name: Thumb Stretch
stretches.description: Pull thumb back gently with other hand, stretching the thumb muscles. Critical for smartphone and mouse users.

stretches.name: Desk Forearm Stretch
stretches.description: Place palms flat on desk with fingers pointing toward body, gently lean back. Perfect desk stretch for office workers.

stretches.name: Fist to Fan Stretch
stretches.description: Make a tight fist, then open hand wide spreading all fingers. Alternate slowly. Increases hand circulation and flexibility.

stretches.name: Finger Pulls
stretches.description: Gently pull each finger backward one at a time with opposite hand. Relieves tension from typing and fine motor work.

stretches.name: Desk Push-Up (Wrist Mobility)
stretches.description: Hands on desk, fingers pointing at body, gently lean forward and back. Strengthens wrists while stretching flexors.

stretches.name: Rubber Band Finger Extensions
stretches.description: Place rubber band around fingers and thumb, open hand against resistance. Balances grip strength with extension strength.

stretches.name: Forearm Pronation/Supination
stretches.description: Arms at sides, elbows bent 90 degrees, rotate forearms so palms face up then down. Improves forearm mobility for typing.
